title: NEW MASTERIES DISCUSSION: Do or Do Not like them?
body:
The new masteries are such a massively huge change from the old ones, as someone else said, it DOES feel like a new game... 

HOW DOES EVERYONE FEEL ABOUT THE FACT YOU CAN ONLY HAVE 5 OR 1 POINT IN EACH ROW? I'm personally stumped haha! I want to choose a lot more than I am allowed to... I assume the idea is to choose one of the last options at the bottom.. But this is LoL assuming that one row fulfils what that champ with that choice is right.. I just don't like how it makes you only have ONE or the OTHER in the one line. 

My general thought so far is I DON'T like the new masteries at all although I definitely agree they needed tweaking/adjusting, but this whole way I feel is really limiting... we are all going to have more likely the same masteries and this is making the game more that we all have the same the same whereas with the other masteries we could be more daring, mix it up and add our own flavour to it. 


I feel I just was starting to understand the masteries and the picks, but now they are all over the place and I don't understand them. If I don't pick a whole row and end up with one of the bottom picks, does that mean I'm missing out on a better buff/bonus?

replies.body: The mastery changes is another thing that this game really needed to freshen it up, after like 4 years in this game, the last few patches as well as the riot support staff team have left me very impressed :). Go Team!
TBH i like how they are more streamlined, so you can really crack down on what you want for that champ-which i think is awesome{{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}
Don't you feel the 3 options aren't clear-cut? As in, I feel you could sup, adc and jg from bits and pieces from each row, but now you don't have that choice

Yea i see where you are coming from
What im meaning is like if you are a healing supp you take Windspeakers blessing- and so on

So yea you cants just take "This and that" but it is a lot more streamlined in my opnion
100% better! each option is much more impactful now and masteries overall are more impactful.
I feel like Masteries actually mean something in the game now, especially with the keystones. It definitely feels to open up other ways to play and build each champ!
Honestly apart from the thunderstone mastery bug, they are amazing.
Some ok but no use for tanks, adcs can now shred tanks like it's nothing.
Read: you don't know what you should have on a tank
They updated it. They don't provide that much bonus Armour and magic resist like they did last time with the  tenacity.

Tanks are fine, if not a ton better with these new masteries.

Tank supports now have 8% damage reduction and can actually take damage for team mates.

Tanks can also if they choose heal 3% of their health every 4 seconds.

Legitimately tanks are better off in the current masteries then in the old.
old ones so much better, new ones make champions to OP and unfair. the old masteries were more balanced. also dislike how you can only put a certain amount into each mastery

I really like them... but am I the only one that has the biscuit as AP mid?
And if I'm not the only one, am I the only one feeling weird about it?

i use the biscuit, and follow down to thunderlord :) i like it.

Makes {{champion:4}}  mean something now!

Gives more reason to use my Legendary/Legacy {{champion:4}} skin :)
I take the biscuit too but it makes me feel cheap and dirty.

I reckon there's a lot of different ways to do things with the new masteries. From what I've seen you can pretty much swap either Ferocity or Resolve for Cunning and still be effective, it's all about how you wanna play right? I've seen mids with 18 in Cunning that do just fine. I love it! Though I do think maybe Strength of the Ages needs tweaking....it's just so inferior to Bond of Stone atm. 

I think it's perfectly ok to go 18/6/6 in mid, take Explorer for the roam and Secret Stash for the biscuits. It does mean forgoing Insight though, but now that Distortion is coming back a bit maybe you don't want/need it.

That's my take on the new masteries anyway.
They punish you for falling behind.
